summary.para: Represents the properties, methods, and other objects of the SQL Server CE Engine. This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeEngine.#ctor(System.String)

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified local connection string.

member.param: src connection string

summary.para: Releases all SQL Server CE resources.
Frees resources before the is reclaimed by the Garbage Collector.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeEngine.Compact(System.String)

summary.para: Reclaims wasted space in the SQL Server CE database. The method is also used to change the collating order, encryption, or password of the SQL Server CE database. For more information, see the SQL Server CE Books Online.

member.param: destination connection string

summary.para: Creates a new database.
Gets or sets the connection string for the SQL Server CE database.
Options used by when specifying the index range over which to .
Includes the startData value in the range.
Includes the endData value in the range.
Excludes the startData value from the range.
Excludes the endData value from the range.
Excludes null values from the range.
Specifies a range where index values begin with the value of startData. In this case, endData must be set to null.
Specifies a range where index values match the value of startData. In this case, endData must be set to null.
Equivalent to InclusiveStart | InclusiveEnd.
Options that specify how to on an index.
Advances to the first matching row on the index, in index order.
Advances to the last matching row on the index, in index order.
Advances to the last matching row on the index. If there are no matching rows, advances to the first row with values after the seek value, in index order.
Advances to the first row with values after the seek value, in index order.
Advances to the first matching row on the index. If there are no matching rows, advances to the last row with values before the seek value, in index order.
Advances to the last row with values before the seek value, in index order.
Specifies whether or not the table being pulled to the device is tracked.
Indicates that SQL Server CE does not track changes to the pulled table. No PRIMARY KEY constraints are created locally.
Indicates that SQL Server CE tracks all changes to the pulled table. Indexes and PRIMARY KEY constraints that existed on the SQL Server table specified in are created on the local table.
Indicates that SQL Server CE does not track changes to the pulled table. Indexes and PRIMARY KEY constraints that existed on the SQL Server table specified in are created on the local table.
Specifies whether or not the rows associated with the should be batched together in a single transaction.
Indicates that SQL Server CE does not batch rows pushed to SQL Server. The server processes each row. (Default)
Indicates that SQL Server CE batches the rows pushed to SQL Server into a single transaction.
Initializes a new instance of the object. For more information about Remote Data Access, see the SQL Server CE Books Online.
Initializes a new instance of the object.

The OLE DB connection string for the SQL Server CE database.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the object and configures it for a Basic or Integrated Windows authentication to Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS).

member.param: The URL used to connect to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
The login name used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
The password used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
The OLE DB connection string for the SQL Server CE database.

summary.para: Releases all unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Pull(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Extracts data from a SQL Server database and stores it in a table in a SQL Server CE database.

member.param: The name of the SQL Server CE table that will receive the extracted SQL Server records. An error occurs if the table already exists.

Any valid Transact-SQL statement, including SELECT statements and stored procedures, that specifies which table, columns, and records to extract from the SQL Server database for storing in the SQL Server CE database.
The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Pull(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption)

summary.para: Extracts data from a SQL Server database and stores it in a table in a SQL Server CE database. Specifies whether index information should be included and if changes made to the pulled table should be tracked.

member.param: The name of the SQL Server CE table that will receive the extracted SQL Server records. An error occurs if the table already exists.

Any valid Transact-SQL statement, including SELECT statements and stored procedures, that specifies which table, columns, and records to extract from the SQL Server database for storing in the SQL Server CE database.
The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

The option indicating whether SQL Server CE tracks changes made to the pulled table and if the indexes that exist on the table being pulled are brought down to the device with the PRIMARY KEY constraints.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Pull(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption,System.String)

summary.para: Extracts data from a SQL Server database and stores it in a table in a SQL Server CE database.

member.param: The name of the SQL Server CE table that will receive the extracted SQL Server records. An error occurs if the table already exists.

Any valid Transact-SQL statement, including SELECT statements and stored procedures, that specifies which table, columns, and records to extract from the SQL Server database for storing in the SQL Server CE database.
The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

The option indicating whether SQL Server CE tracks changes made to the pulled table and if the indexes that exist on the table being pulled are brought down to the device with the PRIMARY KEY constraints.

The name of the local error table that is created if an error occurs when the Push method is later called to send changes back to SQL Server. This option can be specified only when the value is TrackingOn or TrackingOnWithIndexes.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Push(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Transmits changes from a pulled tracked table in SQL Server CE back to the originating SQL Server table. These changes are individually applied to the server in separate transactions.

member.param: The name of the SQL Server CE table that will receive the extracted SQL Server records. An error occurs if the table already exists.
The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Push(System.String,System.String,System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaBatchOption)

summary.para: Transmits changes from a pulled tracked table in SQL Server CE back to the SQL Server table. These changes can be either individually applied to the server or batched together in a single transaction.

member.param: The name of the SQL Server CE table that will receive the extracted SQL Server records. An error occurs if the table already exists.
The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.
The option indicates whether the changes being sent back to the SQL Server table should be batched together in a single transaction or individually applied.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.SubmitSql(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Submits SQL statements for execution on a database in Microsoft SQL Server on a remote server.

member.param: Any SQL statement that does not return rows.
The OLE DB connection string for the remote SQL Server database.

summary.para: Specifies the OLE DB connection string for the SQL Server CE database on the Microsoft Windows CE .NET-based device.

Specifies the URL used to connect to the SQL Server CE Server Agent. The SQL Server CE Server Agent is the Microsoft Information Services (IIS) ISAPI DLL that connects the Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Windows CE Edition (SQL Server CE) client to the Microsoft SQL Server Database. This property must be specified.
Specifies the Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) login name used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
Specifies the Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) password used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
Specifies the proxy server to use when accessing the HTTP resource specified in the property.
Specifies the login name used when connecting to a proxy server (defined in the property) that requires authentication.
Specifies the password used when connecting to a proxy server (defined in the property) that requires authentication.
Specifies the source of the newly created SQL Server CE database.
Assumes the SQL Server CE database is already created.
Causes the SQL Server CE database to be created on the Windows CE .NET-based device.
Specifies whether to leave or delete the SQL Server CE database during a drop subscription.
Deletes the replication system tables and three replication system columns in the user tables, but does not delete the database.
Deletes the SQL Server CE database.
Specifies the network protocol used.
Use the current configured client Net-Library.
Use the TCP/IP Sockets Net Library.
Use the Multiprotocol Net Library.
Specifies the mode of security enforced.
SQL Server standard security (default).
Windows Authentication.
Specifies whether data merges up to the Publisher or in both directions between the Publisher and the Subscriber
Merges only the Subscriber changes with the Publisher.
Merges all changes between the Publisher and Subscriber (default).
Specifies the type of data validation to perform.
Do no validation (default).
Do a row count comparison on the published data.

Initializes a new instance of the object. For more information on replication, see SQL Server Books Online. For more information on merge replication in SQL Server CE, see the SQL Server CE Books Online.
Initializes a new instance of the object. Default Constructor.

summary.para: Releases all native resources.
Releases the resources held by this instance.

Creates a new anonymous subscription to an existing Microsoft SQL Server publication. After calling the method, the application must call the method to synchronize the new subscription to the publication based on the latest snapshot.
Drops the subscription to a SQL Server publication and optionally deletes the SQL Server CE database from the Windows CE .NET-based device.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.ReinitializeSubscription(System.Boolean)

summary.para: Marks a subscription for reinitialization. After calling , an application must call the method to download the latest snapshot of the publication to the device.

member.param: If True, the changes in the subscription database are uploaded to the Publisher before the snapshot is applied at the Subscriber. The default is False.

summary.para: Invokes merge replication between the SQL Server CE subscription and the SQL Server Publisher.
Specifies the SQL Server Distributor.
Specifies the network protocol used when the SQL Server Reconciler communicates with the Distributor.
Specifies the network address used when the SQL Server Reconciler is connecting to the Distributor.
Specifies the security mode used when connecting to the Distributor.
Specifies the login name used when connecting to the Distributor.
Specifies the login password used when connecting to the Distributor.
Specifies whether the synchronization between the Publisher and the Subscriber is bi-directional or upload only.
Sets the host name used for the device when connecting to the Publisher.
Specifies the URL used to connect to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
Specifies the login name used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
Specifies the password used when connecting to the SQL Server CE Server Agent.
Specifies the proxy server to use when accessing the HTTP resource specified in the property.
Specifies the login name used when connecting to an that requires authentication.
Specifies the password used when connecting to an InternetProxyServer that requires authentication.
Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for connections to be established.
Specifies the name of the agent profile at the Distributor to be used by the object.
Specifies the name of the Publisher. The Publisher is the computer that is running SQL Server and that contains the publication.
Specifies the network protocol used when the SQL Server Replication Provider communicates with the Publisher.
Specifies the network address used when connecting to the Publisher.
Specifies the security mode used when connecting to the Publisher.
Specifies the login name used when connecting to the Publisher.
Specifies the login password used when connecting to the Publisher.
Specifies the name of the publication database.
Specifies the publication name that has been enabled for anonymous merge subscriptions.
Specifies the total number of Publisher changes applied at the Subscriber when the method was last called.
Specifies the total number of conflicts that occurred at the Publisher when the method was last called.
Specifies the number of seconds allowed for internal queries to complete.
Specifies the name of the Subscriber.
Specifies the OLE DB connection string for the SQL Server CE database on the Windows CE .NET-based device.
Specifies the total number of Subscriber changes applied at the Publisher when the Synchronize method was last called.
Specifies the type of data validation SQL Server CE replication performs while synchronizing.

summary.para: Represents an SQL transaction to be made at a data source. This class cannot be inherited.
Releases all objects associated with the transaction.
Frees resources before the is reclaimed by the Garbage Collector.

summary.para: Commits the database transaction.

member.exception: An error occured while trying to commit the transaction.

exception.para: The transaction has already been committed or rolled back.
-or-
The connection is broken.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeTransaction.Rollback

summary.para: Rolls back a transaction from a pending state.

member.exception: An error occured while trying to commit the transaction.

exception.para: The transaction has already been committed or rolled back.
-or-
The connection is broken.

summary.para: Gets the object associated with the transaction, or if the transaction is no longer valid.
Specifies the for this transaction.
